Reviews.Title: “Great Value with Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleAnn
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and was pretty satisfied with the stay. It's a smoking hotel, so all of the rooms smell like smoke, the hallway, lobby and elevator smell of it, too. The carpet in our room seemed like it hadn't been cleaned in awhile, but the hotel must have heard this one before because they provide complimetary slippers. When I first sat on the bed it was like sitting on a block on cement. It was so hard that when I plopped down, I hurt myself. There is absolutely no cushion, no bounce, no movement to this bed. But surprisingly I had one of the best sleeps I've ever had. It's the strangest thing... The wifi was hit or miss. I asked the front desk to help and they were pretty useless. If you're expecting good customer service, you're not going to find it here. The front desk doesn't have any interest in telling where to go, how to get there, or provide any general information about the property. This wasn't a problem for us since we got in late every night and left really early. It's a prime location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “good location dirty room”
Reviews.Author: Yasemin K
Reviews.Content: the place is great near to soho, little italy... BUT our room was not clean and the bathroom also.. it was terrible... never again for this money..

Reviews.Title: “Good & Clean Chinatown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HalBoston
Reviews.Content: Great location - in walking distance of the Metro, Little Italy, East Village - very basic amenities. You may need to ask for extra towels, or toilet roll- Happy with Clean beds. Bathroom could be updated - as with the carpeting throughout the property. Located on Forsyth Street opposite open community space/park. Nice change from being boxed in.

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean no bed bugs or other critters”
Reviews.Author: Bruce D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, the first night I had a really hard bed and would have done better sleeping on the floor. The night shift clerk "starting at midnight" is a real jerk and does not help or know anything. had message light on the phone and he said there are no messages "written" for you. asked how I listen to my phone messages and all he could say is call back in the morning to talk to the manager. The room is very clean, it does not have a fridge as stated by write up and are very small. The price is right for $70.00 per night but I would not pay any more for it. It is in china town which is very run down, I never had any problems walking around even late at night when returning at 2am. There is a corner store across the street which is open til 12am and the hotel is close by to little italy and is in china town. It is right on the Grand street subway D line with access to anywhere you want to go. There is an excellent cafe about 3 blocks away called the cup and saucer which has 2 greek cooks. It is a small place with limited seating but the food and prices are awesome. You can easily get filled up for breakfast for about 7.00 here including your coffee "remember I said greek so it is thick and strong coffee". Over on allen st there is an excellent bar that has live country/folk music nightly with each band playing for about 1 hr sets. Over all for my first time to NY it was a clean, safe and comfortable room with really good front desk staff in the morning and afternoon who are quite knowledgeable and helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: triss77
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean Hotel. No bedbugs in our room and the room was cleaned every day. It was close to the subway and it took only 10-15 min to walk to the shopping at Broadway. The staff was ok. One guy was really serviceminded, the others were nice and polite but nothing more. The area was ok, we felt pretty safe but I wouldnâ€™t like to go through the park too late in the night. Although two problems, donâ€™t sleep on the groundfloor. You could hear everything at the front desk including the front door slamming, we changed room after one night. The second thing, the taxi drivers had difficulties to finding the hotel, even if we showed the hotel on map. Try to point out the biggest street nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean beds, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Toldnaes
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look old, but the carpets and the lobby look like chaos. The beds were clean and comfy, but the bathroom and especially the shower should have been cleaned much better. The we paid approx. $1000 for 4 nights, and it is most definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I real find reasonable rates clean and comfortable in nyc”
Reviews.Author: travel_light58
Reviews.Content: this small hotel is clean comfortable and a value for New York City. Literately STEPS away from the grand street subway. This hotel has free wifi , flat screen TV modern bed linens. The young men at the front desk are very polite and helpful. My stay here was great!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent cheaper option”
Reviews.Author: TopGunPires
Reviews.Content: If you dont want to pay top dollar and aren't fussed about a glitzy hotel in midtown then this is the place for you. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side but this is always the case in NYC. Our room was cleaned to an excellent standard daily, the bathroom had an excellent shower and hairdryer. The location of this place is fantastic. Grand Street subway is a 2min walk away and provides great transport links. Chinatown is on your doorstep, Little Italy is less than a 5min walk and great shopping can be found on Broadway less than a 10min walk away. Good breakfast bagels can be got from the shop/deli on the opposite corner of Forsyth for a fraction of the midtown costs. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and a perfect base”
Reviews.Author: SusieJT
Reviews.Content: Small room but big enough for the two of us, we were only there to sleep and change to go back out in the evening. Fresh towels every day, some traffic noise from the next street over but not awful - didn't disturb our sleep. Hotel staff helpful, some more confident speaking English than others but we didn't need to ask for much. Organised our taxi to JFK on last day and gave us a room to store our bags and get changed before leaving. Fab location, bit of a culture shock first day (but we were tired too!) felt like a safe area and subway station less than a block. Nice little shop on the corner so handy to buy soft drinks. Walk through Chinatown & Little Italy for Broadway, Soho, Financial District etc. East Village in the other direction. Very handy and would recommend for anyone who isn't looking for expensive, high class, generic impersonal place to stay. Much more cosmopolitan!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room was barebones but great location”
Reviews.Author: adhn
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NY with my husband and my son in June 2011. We booked a room here for 1 week. The hotel was very basic. There were 2 double beds and a TV with cable. The room was very small. It has air conditioner. The location was very convenient. You can walk to all the affordable restaurants in Chinatown. Little Itaty is only a couple of blocks away. Subway station is only a block walk. We were out all day and only came back to sleep. It was quite safe even at night. You can ask the front clerk for car service to the airport if needed. We took a taxi from JFK airport to the hotel. If you like to go out at night, there were lots of bars that are within walking distance. Internet service was provided.

Reviews.Title: “VERY basic set up, double bed only not queen, good for short stay, clean”
Reviews.Author: TrixyPo_Oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It was a last minute find as i didnt realise how exy accom was in NYC and how much it was booked up. Very convenient location to two metro lines that get you pretty much anywhere in nyc. So location is excellent. We spent most time out and about so crashing for night was no biggie. Wife didnt like it much, thought she saw the ghost of a man who she suspects was killed there. Private bathroom was clean. Wasnt great value as we booked last minute (within 2 weeks) but it did us fine, even travelling with a baby who slept in the stroller. It is not luxury by any means but provided and excellent base for touring nyc easily by metro. Bed not that comfy. If youre happy to sleep basic, in the city that never sleeps, then stay here as it is convenient, clean, seems pretty safe, and you can rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, very small but clean”
Reviews.Author: Prest0nlass
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Grand Street subway station which makes it ideal to get away quickly from the area. Although the hotel seems clean the smell of 'herbal' cigarettes wafting through the hotel was off putting. The room was extremely small and very cold, and the electric wall heater was very noisy. All in all it was cheap and somewhere to sleep but I found the staff very unhelpful as I had emailed the hotel prior to the visit requesting is some extra touches could be added as it was the hubbys 40th but no reply was received and on arriving none of the staff who were on reception had a basic grasp of the English language to understand my request.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RamSox
Reviews.Content: Travelling to NYC in Spring or Fall is an expesive business! During these popular months hotel proces in Manhattan go crazy, so any hotel that is clean, safe and less than $200 a night must be good value. We stayed 3 nights at the Windsor. On the first night we were on the ground floor and it was very noisy. The next day we requested a move to a higher floor which the staff arranged for us without any problems. The following 2 nights were less noisy and we slept well. The hotel is clean, the facilities are basic but overall the hotel delivers good value. The hotel is located in China town and close to Little Italy. We had no problem with safety or security and the hotel is only about 150m from a subway sation that gives direct access to Midtown. The subway was always busy (we returned at 1130pm at night) and we never felt concerned. For anyone not wanting to pay $400 per night for a generic 4-star hotel in Midtown this hotel offers a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, and room, Loud Club next door”
Reviews.Author: Glitta2000
Reviews.Content: This place is a great price, great location, clean room and safe neighborhood. Free wi fi really came in handy. Nothing fancy but will do if you are trying to get a good price on hotel while in the city. The only problem was we had a window that faced the club across the street. It was very loud during the weekend and on one week night we were there. We finally figured if you left the tv on all night that would drown out the noise. The only way I would recommend this hotel if you be sure to ask for a room on the opposite side of the club located on Broome st.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value hotel. Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: smgalbraith
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend. It is relatively affordable (by New York standards at least), has excellent subway access, and staff was very friendly. Somehow our bed had 2 box springs instead of a boxspring and mattress. Staff were apologetic and gave us a new (better) room right away. The new mattress was very firm, but we prefer that... pillow top fans need not apply. The windows in the room open, and the air conditioner worked great. The room was very quiet at night. LCD tvs in the rooms and free WIFI. We will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JMikeM
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing fancy, but is in a great location in Chinatown and the subway is 100 yards from the front door. Clearly a 2 star property in terms of services (of lack there of). However, room was very clean, the 1 person at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, and all of the fixtures were in good working order. The 30" flat panel TV seemed relatively new. I've seen older posts that the hallways were run down and the beds uncomfortable. However, that was not our experience. Both double beds in our room were comfortable and the hallways were clean and well kept. Perhaps there has been some recent renovation since those posts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money but Not for the Weak-Willed or Those Who Seek Luxury”
Reviews.Author: olamina
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Hotel is a good place to stay, as long as you accept that it is not exactly what it advertises itself to be. The safes in the room don't work (the kid at the counter offered to hold on to my valuables. Thanks but no thanks) and the wireless was down, but the hotel is clean, you don't have to share a bathroom with anyone, and besides that one sort of harebrained kid, everyone else at the desk was totally cool and super helpful. Plus it is located in one of the coolest parts of the city. A couple of blocks to either the Lower East Side, Little Italy, Soho, East Village, and right on a quiet strip of Chinatown. We had some issues with the plumbing in the room, but after "shoving" that kid at the desk around a bit, he finally gave us another room that worked. The neighborhood has personality. One morning we awoke to find a man collapsed in front of the door of the hotel, but the ambulance quickly came around to grab him. Plus the police seem to enjoy hanging out in the lobby there, so you don't have to worry about any hanky panky down there (not that that's much of a concern. NYC is an incredibly safe city). All in all, I was impressed by Windsor and would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: BrightonJonnykansas
Reviews.Content: well i read some of the reviews on here and nearly didnt stay here, what a mistake that would have been. If you want a luxurios hotel, bedroom and bathroom then DONT stay here. If you want a perfectly fine room, for the price, its great. You are in a great area i think, chinatown, little italy, greenwich a bit further, all easily walkable, or there is the subway 2mins from the hotel. There are great bars round the corner, the Ten Bells and the Liquor lounge. The room was fine, clean, safe. Yes the water takes a few minutes to run hot. There is a safe in the room. The staff were great, and will sort out a cab back to JFK at the right price any time of day/night. Yes if you want to feel that you are in a proper area of new york, i would recommend it. Me and two mates stayed here, all late 30's. We walked nearly everywhere and had a great time being based at the windsor.

Reviews.Title: “The previous reviews are out of date. The hotel has been renovated and is good value.”
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgedCoupleUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel says that it was completely renovated in late 2009. When we stayed in early 2010, our room was very clean, newly decorated and newly furnished. The common parts of the hotel, even the back stairs, were also clean and newly painted. The rooms are small but excellent value and very well located if you want to be in the heart of downtown Manhattan. Our room on the top floor had two small double beds: sufficient for two couples of normal size, but not perhaps for very fat people! It had a desk, a chest of drawers and a new Sony flat screen TV. There was a lobby with hanging space and a clean, newly equipped bathroom (bath with shower over). The room had a safe. There was one chair but little space for anything more. The hotel had very recently installed wireless Internet access points on each of the upper floors which they got working during our stay. Internet access (when we finally got it) was free. This is essentially a self-service hotel. Free coffee and hot water for tea is available at the reception desk. There is a kitchen in the basement with a microwave and ice machine. There was one person on duty at reception 24 hours a day. All the staff we dealt with were Chinese. Not all were fluent in English. They were all friendly and helpful but there is a limit to what help they can provide. If you are looking for large rooms or a high level of service or a swanky location, this hotel is not for you. We liked the room and the hotel and loved being in the heart of the Lower East Side on the edge of Chinatown. You can easily walk to Wall Street or to Midtown from here. For us the location was much better than midtown and the price was half of what we would have paid there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - first time post because i felt so strongly”
Reviews.Author: sk-6100
Reviews.Content: This is a dirty hotel in a bad location. The rrooms are dirty and the service is bad. the Chinese man at the receptionist is angry.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel; definitely not worth expense”
Reviews.Author: no8dochica
Reviews.Content: For $250/night, I expected much better. What was described as a room that would comfortably house three adults was tiny (perhaps 10 by 12) with a twin and a bed described as a full that was actually a twin with six more inches of width meant to hold two adults. The mattresses were rock-hard and stained with what looked like blood. The fitted sheets did not fit the mattresses. The comforters were almost crunchy in texture. The blankets had something on them that made me sneeze whenever I was near them. I can only hope the mystery substance was a cleaning chemical and not mold, mildew, or worse. I woke up every day with a terrible back and neck ache that required several minutes of stretching and medication. We barely had room to move around in the room, which did not include windows that opened, a clock, closet, or space to stow luggage. We tripped over luggage all week because we each brought out own suitcase and had nowhere to place luggage that was out of the way. The bathroom's size was consistent with the bedroom. The only way two adults could be in it at the same time is if one was in the shower while the other used the sink. The temperature of the shower water was okay, but the water pressure was dreadful. It alternated between fire hose pressure and nothing at all. Like everything else, the towels were too small. They barely sufficed to dry an adult body. We opted to hang the "do not disturb" sign all week rather than allow the maids to clean because they turned off the air conditioner despite 95 degree heat. We only made the mistake of allowing them to enter once. The hotel does not supply breakfast. Because the site did not list this as an amenity, this is not a complaintâ€”merely information for travelers interested in this hotel. The location was acceptable: within walking distance of Little Italy and Nolita as well as several subway stations. A convenience store on the corner supplies sodas, snacks, gum, and other little items and is open late. For breakfast, try the Cup and Saucer (a diner four of five blocks awayâ€”ask a hotel employee). Hotel employees were very helpful and friendly. It was weird to have to supply a credit card in case of "incidental charges," a nebulous term never further defined. I assume this refers to stealing or damaging hotel property. I would not stay here again or recommend it to other travelers. I've stayed in much nicer hotels for half the money. Keep looking: the Windsor Hotel is not where you want to spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Small and Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pabrigarcia
Reviews.Content: Very very bad. Small room, rooms dont open the windows and in rooms are very hot and dirty. The workers do not solve the problems and are bad-mannered. If you have the room of below (down), you listening to the whole world in the street and inside the hotel and not sleeping for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “w/ mixed reviews wasn't sure what to expect. .”
Reviews.Author: TrentBoston
Reviews.Content: Turned out perfect. Clean and efficient. Firm king size bed. Friendly staff. Excellent location. Happily away from da tourists.

Reviews.Title: “really good deal and convenient to subway”
Reviews.Author: theatermaven
Reviews.Content: hotel room was small, which I expected, but was immaculately clean, and linens and furnishings were in very good shape. Other positives: half the price of midtown hotels, friendly staff, lively neighborhood with lots of dining options (in Chinatown, but easy walking distance to Lower East Side shops and trendy NoLiTa boutiques.) Bonus points for being a half-block from Grand St. subway station, which was an express stop. You are in the theater district in less than 10 minutes (4 stops)! I felt very safe using subway late at night with teenage daughter. Negatives: Shower has some kind of water-saving feature that causes the water to come in pulses instead of a steady stream. (but there was always hot water!) In lieu of a closet, there was a wall-mounted rack that was suspended over one of the beds, which was not terribly convenient.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not worth your money...”
Reviews.Author: Kwanvin
Reviews.Content: Very small room as well as the bed (I'm not sure that it is a real queen size bed). There were 4 people in our group so I try to pay extra (10 dollars per night) to upgrade my room to a biggest one. And I pay more (20 Dollars per night)for one single extra bed. They gave me a key to move our stuffs to new room by ourselves. More over, when we are back from our trip in the evening they did not add any extra bed to my new room so I have to call them to finish it and they said they forgot to. Moreover there is no staff available at that time so I have to wait for more than 15 minutes for their staff to finish their dinner!!! I've heard that hotel was recently refurbished but I don't think so. Room's door was a bit broken as well as bath room door. There is no wardrobe and the towels is not clean. One day before I check out I ask reception to book a van for me to JFK because I went there with my parents and my brother and we had 6 luggages, but they don't....Their staff din't book any car for me as they promise to!! When I checked out I have to wait for them to call taxi immediately and that staff said.."You don't have to worried there is a lot of time." How they can say that....What if I miss my flight? Moreover, they tried to get us in one normal taxi and said they cannot find a van right at that time. That was unacceptable for me. Finally, after 20 minutes we got a van and the reception said I have to pay 60 dollars for a van but when I got to JFK the driver said I have to pay 65.. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: lovleee72
Reviews.Content: I love this place!! Excellent non-tourist location. Train across the street!! It does stink outside from all the street vendors, but you're in New York it stinks on Park Ave!?!?! Friendly staff, clean room, overall comfortable stay. Puts you right in the lower east side. No, it's not a 4 star but it has a comfortable bed, clean rooms, and friendly staff, I stay in NYC a lot and have never enjoyed my stay as much.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and inhospitable”
Reviews.Author: supercoolandtrendy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Windsor Hotel with my 15 year old son for 3 nights and can honestly say that in all my travels this was the most awful place I have ever stayed. The area is rundown and there were guys on the street hanging out and drinking beer. It is not the place for a woman to stayalone with her child but i had never been to new York before and the travel agent told me it would be fine! On arrival there was no bell boy and we had to hump our cases up to our room ourselves which was unacceptable as I have mobility problems. The safety deposit box is not fixed to the room and can be carried off by anyone entering the room. The room was small and clean ,but shabby. We had been informed that the hotel had been recently refurbished but we did not see any evidence of this. there was no wardrobe and we had to hang all of our clothes across the back of the chair and rummage through them each morning to select what we both wanted to wear. Also, the curtain was hanging off the window and there was no slip mat in the shower/bath. Im no fattie but the towels wouldnt cover the modesty of a three year old child and they were old and hard. If I had paid budget prices for this stay then I wouldnt be complaining but we paid top dollar for this holiday and not even a cup of coffee in the morning! My son developed really large blisters on his foot from our long walk on day one in Manhattan which were really painful but when I asked for a plaster (band aid) at reception they didnt even have a first aid box. I was appalled by this and had to go into town to find a chemist . It worried me that if either of us became ill or needed emergency first aid the staff were unprepared. The people of New York were nothing like the staff at the Windsor and we loved them. They are the most friendly people in the world and offered us help and assistance on getting about and using the subway on several occasions. We got to know some really cool people and have brilliant memories of our stay. We will definately visit NYC again but will not be staying at the Windsor.

Reviews.Title: “shabby”
Reviews.Author: Sunnygirl83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 4star hotel, there is nothing at all that could bring it anywhere near a 2 star hotel Booked as a double standard, sub standard would be more fitting The room was very small, as was the bed, no wardrobe, the wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the shower took 5 minutes to run hot but was ok then As we were staying for a week we asked if there was a larger room available, credit to the lad on reception who offered us a larger room for a couple of nights but said we would have to swap back again over the weekend, and then could have the larger room back, we looked at the room, which was larger but was really smelly so we declined, the bedding wasn't changed at all while we were there On the plus side if China Town is high on your list this hotel is minutes from there and Little Italy,the subway station is 150 metres from the hotel and very safe and cheap to use

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel in marginal location, next to a nightclub. Lobby and elevator was dirty with trash on the floors. Room reeked and you couldn't open the windows. Stains on the carpet and drapes hanging off the rods. Motel 6 was better than this place and the gall to charge $225 a night. They asked for your driver's license at check-in to input your DL# and birthdate. They charged your entire stay when you check in. If this place was the last hotel in New York City, I still would not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to expensive Midtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sparafucile2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April 2005. It was a trip that we organised at the last minute and we were being quoted $250 dollars and more (much more) per night at other hotels that had vacancy's. We were a little concerned about staying in the Lower East Side, but we did not have many (any) alternatives and at $150 per night, we decided to go for it. The hotel itself is about average, very clean and the rooms were serviced each day. It is a modern hotel, but it is starting to show some signs of wear. The bathroom is modernish, but I prefer modern over antique charm any day so it was fine. It was necessary to run the shower for a few minutes to get hot water, but once we had worked this out, it was not a major problem. We reported this to the hotel and they say that they are aware of the problem and that they are trying to get it fixed. Having initially been concerned about the area, I can now say that I would be more than happy to stay here again. I particularly enjoyed watching the locals do Tai Chi each morning in the recreation area opposite (sometimes with ornamental swords). It is on the fringe of China Town & Little Italy with a great choice of restaurants bars etc and great shopping is available along Broadway on the way to Soho just a five to ten minute walk away. There is a Subway Station (B&D lines) 1 minute away and another (J&Z) about 2 minutes away. The NYC Subway is very easy to use and runs 24 hrs so we were able to go uptown, downtown and all around town to our hearts content. I understand that a taxi to Times Square is about $10 but we just used the subway. It is a very safe area. We did not feel uneasy at any time. If you pull your tourist guide out of your pocket, one of the locals will come up to you and offer to help you find your way. There was a small grocery store located opposite that was run by some South American people. I think that it also doubled as a kinda social club and we got to know the people there who were friendly & entertaining. The hotel staff were extremely friendly offering advice on restaurants, places to visit, transfers to the airport, really anything was not too much trouble. We enjoyed the area much more than expected. Actually the area and its cultural diversity added to a very enjoyable visit. I would certainly try and stay in this area or Soho when we next visit and if the price is right I would stay at this hotel again. I hope that this helps you when you are planning your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here 4th Dec 04 smashing place lovely clean room and en-suite cleaned every day Its run bt chineese people who were lovely and very polite.I was just a bit put off by the area.Its in china town and if you want to spend time in the evenings up in time square you take your chances on getting a taxi back to the hotel. As it goes dark around 4o,clock at that time of year we felt a bit tied,as some taxi drivers when you could flag one would not go all the way back to china town.But we started out early in the morning walking as much as possible,otherwise the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good money saving hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffPatt
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely furnished with new carpet and newish bathroom. The AC worked very well and the view was nice - with a little parkette across the street. BUT we found 2 cockroaches in the bathtub one morning. The hotel staff were VERY nice and allowed us an early check-in. I parked my car on Broome St. for the weekend without getting a ticket ! You really get what you pay for with this hotel. It's very standard and the rooms are by no means big. So if you're an older couple or picky - shell out the extra dough for a nicer place. If you're a student or not very picky - totally go for it. I've spent more for worse places.

HotelInfo.Name: Windsor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 108 Forsyth Street, New York City, NY 10002
